user_stories: As a team member, I want to see the first iteration of beta up on cloud.gov
As a developer, I want to have the subdomain beta.nsf.gov be set up, so that I can deploy a beta site to it
As an NSF employee, I want to understand the process of switching the cloud.gov hosting plan over from prototype to FISMA low
tasks: Create cloud.gov account for the team
Set up a new cloud.gov project
Configure project settings for beta deployment
Create a new repository for the beta iteration
Initialize Git repository with basic project structure
Write a simple "Hello World" application for beta
Configure continuous integration pipeline for beta
Deploy "Hello World" application to cloud.gov
Verify beta iteration is accessible on cloud.gov
Create a new DNS record for beta.nsf.gov
Set up a new server or environment for beta site deployment
Configure load balancer to route traffic to beta site server
Generate SSL certificate for beta.nsf.gov
Configure SSL certificate on beta site server
Update deployment script to deploy to beta site server
Test beta site deployment to ensure successful setup
Research cloud.gov hosting plan options (prototype and FISMA low)
Document current prototype hosting plan configuration
Determine required changes for FISMA low hosting plan
Create step-by-step guide for switching hosting plans
Identify necessary permissions and access for plan switch
Develop script to automate hosting plan switch
Test hosting plan switch in non-production environment
Schedule and execute hosting plan switch in production
Verify FISMA low hosting plan configuration after switch
